intro: Humirianthera duckei, commonly known as the Ducke's humirianthera, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
